intro: Achoriphragma pulvinatum, commonly known as the pulvinate acorid, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acoraceae, which includes a small group of aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and a distinctive, club-shaped inflorescence. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas with standing water. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
